data.title: Untitled Document
data.text:
95.1 WAPE's Mark Kaye Host First-Ever Snapchat Show

THE MOUTH, MARCH 6TH, 2015 –– YouTube, Vine, and Instagram all have super-famous stars who've leveraged the platform to develop a following and even make some money. 95.1 WAPE/Jacksonville's morning host is not only among them, but is also now the host of the first-ever Snapchat talk show: Talkin' Snap. According to businessinsider.com, he uses the show to interview famous Snapchat artists, including Shaun McBride and Evan Garber, as well as musical artists that come through his station. Kaye decided to start his show in August. He tells Jockline: "The show has a weekly audience of over 50,000 people. our first episode was with a popular Snapchat artist named “Shonduras.” Since then I've interviewed two dozen celebs including several musicians who have swung by WAPE. Flo Rida was recently featured as well as Charli XCX, Jake Miller, and even Kevin Jonas. Kevin Jonas was actually the first person to reach out to me and ask to be on my show,” Kaye says. “When a big star asked to be on my show I knew I was on to something.” What's Kaye's ultimate goal with Talkin' Snap? "To make people smile," he says. "With Snapchat my first goal was, how can we make this exciting and new? And I think I've found a way." You might look for Kaye to share this secrets of Snapchat during this year's Morning Show Boot Camp - Aug. 6 & 7 Chicago.

MOTION: KILT-FM Houston Announces Cast Of The Morning Bull

THE MOUTH, MARCH 6TH, 2015 –– Following recent news of longtime Louisville host/PD George Lindsey headed to CBS Radio's 100.3 The Bull, comes word of its full cast for the all-new “The Morning Bull.” Lindsey will also be joined by Monica Lunsford and Cowboy Dave and the show will launch on Monday, March 16. George Lindsey joins The Bull from WXMA in Louisville, Kentucky, where he was operations manager and morning host. Monica Lunsford was previously heard in morning drive on KUPL in Portland, Oregon. Cowboy Dave has been with The Bull since 2010 hosting the station’s night show. “George, Mo and Cowboy Dave each bring a tremendous amount of talent along with their own unique skills to the table,” said Bruce Logan, Vice President of Programming , CBS Radio Houston. Cowboy Dave takes his popular personality to morning after hosting nights since April 2014. The Houston native said, “I’m excited to introduce George and Mo to my hometown, and I hear they love tacos, so you know I’ll be taking ‘em to all my favorite places…hurry up y’all, I’m hungry!” Nick Russo will take over nights on The Bull, hosting from 7:00PM-12:00Midnight, CT.

EXECUTIVE ACTION: Real 92.3 LA Names Abdul "DJ A-OH" Hashem APD/On-Air Host; Mark Abuzzahab To Program VuHaus

THE MOUTH, MARCH 6TH, 2015 –– Real 92.3, LA's Hip Hop N R&B has named Abdul "DJ A-OH" Hashem Assistant Program Director and On-Air Personality, effective immediately. He will join the station from 103.5 The Beat in Miami, where he has served as Program Director and On-Air Personality since October 2013. In addition, he has also serves as an iHeartMedia Urban Brand Coordinator. Prior to that, DJ A-OH was part of the programming team at WGCI-FM in Chicago.

“VuHaus” is unveiled as the brand name for a new, non-profit video collaboration of public radio’s leading music discovery stations. Known by the code name “Music X” since it was announced in May 2014, VuHaus (“view house”) is a collaboration of founding stations WFUV/New York, KCRW/Los Angeles, WXPN/Philadelphia, KUTX/Austin, and KTBG/Kansas City. VuHaus is also proud to announce the addition of Mark Abuzzahab as its Program Director. Abuzzahab joins VuHaus from non-commercial KKXT/Dallas-Ft. Worth where he had been Program Director since 2011. Paragon CEO Mike Henry serves as Senior Creative Director for VuHaus.

56 Years Later, Plane Crash That Took The Lives Of Buddy Holly, Richie Valens And Radio's Big Bopper Case Reopened

THE MOUTH, MARCH 6TH, 2015 –– The National Transportation Safety Board said it was reviewing a petition Wednesday to reopen the investigation into the 1959 crash that left rock Ritchie Valens, 17, Buddy Holly, 22, and J.P. 'Big Bopper' Richardson, 28, dead from a small-plane crash near Clear Lake, Iowa. According to cbc.com The NTSB said it was reviewing a petition Wednesday to reopen the investigation into the crash. The original investigation 56 years ago conducted by the Civil Aeronautics Board blamed the crash on the pilot's decision to embark on an instrument-guided flight he was not certified for and also on poor weather briefing. The NTSB received a request recently from pilot L.J. Coon to reconsider the decision, the Mason City Globe Gazette reported. The NtSB said petitions must be based on the discovery of new evidence or on a showing that the findings are erroneous and not on previously advanced positions. Big Bopper rumors put to rest by autopsy Holly and the others had just completed a concert in Clear Lake, Iowa, on Feb. 2, 1959 and because they had experienced bus trouble on the tour, opted to charter a small airplane to the next tour date in Moorhead, Minnesota. The airplane crashed shortly after taking off from nearby Mason City, Iowa killing the musicians and pilot Roger Peterson, 21. Before launching a recording career, Richardson worked a radio host in Beaumont KTRM (now KZZB). Richardson had seen college students doing a dance called The Bop, and he decided to call himself "The Big Bopper". He eventually became the station's program director. Richardson has often been credited for creating the first music video in 1958.

Westwood One Sports Presents Exclusive NCAA® Women’s Basketball Coverage

THE MOUTH, MARCH 6TH, 2015 –– Westwood One Sports presents a slate of exclusive women’s college basketball broadcasts this month, starting this Sunday, March 8, 2015 with the Pac-12 Women’s Championship game and culminating with the Women’s Final Four and National Championship in Tampa, FL on April 7, 2015. All games can be heard on radio stations nationwide and SiriusXM, and streamed live on westwoodonesports.com, and via TuneIn. The action tips off this weekend with exclusive live coverage of the Pac-12 Women’s Championship from KeyArena in Seattle on Sunday, March 8. Dick Fain has the play-by-play and Krista Blunk is the color analyst. On Tuesday, March 10, Westwood One broadcasts the Big East Women’s Championship, live from Allstate Arena in Chicago. CBS Sports Radio talk-show host Amy Lawrence has the play-by-play, along with former University of Connecticut All-American Swin Cash as the analyst. The NCAA Women's Championship Game will take place on Tuesday, April 7, 2015, beginning at 8:00 pm ET. The trio of John Sadak (play-by-play), Debbie Antonelli (color analyst), and Krista Blunk (courtside reporter) will broadcast all the action of the 2015 NCAA Women’s Final Four. Lance Medow will anchor the pregame, halftime and postgame shows.

Live 105 To Bring The Bay Area A Big F'N Day

THE MOUTH, MARCH 6TH, 2015 –– KITS-FM,LIVE105 will present LIVE 105’s BFD 2015, at the Shoreline Amphitheater on Saturday, June 6th. After a huge sold out show last year, LIVE105 has assembled a line-up of some of the most acclaimed artists in Alternative as well as new up-and-coming bands. LIVE 105 BFD has become widely known to be the Bay Area’s summer kick off music festival. LIVE 105’s BFD 2015 features over 35 bands on four separate stages. The main stage will be lead by full sets from indie rock kings Modest Mouse, Icelandic indie-folk super stars Of Monsters And Men, and indie-pop Panic! At The Disco. The main stage will also feature the indie rock of Cold War Kids, and Australian alt-rockers Atlas Genius. As always the Festival Stage will be feature the current rosters of alternative acts with non-stop music from Twentyone Pilots, Death From Above 1979, Best Coast, The Kooks, Yelawolf, Misterwives, The Orwells, Cathedrals, Meg Meyers, Waters, and In The Valley Below. The Subsonic Tent is always place to check out some of the best names in electronic and EDM music. Featured in the tent will be Martin Solveig, GTA, and Robert Delong along with performances by Vicetone, K.Flay, Mystery Skulls, The Limousines, The tent will also play host to local DJs, Aaron Axelsen, Slaptop, Dyloot, and Mykill, LIVE105’s BFD 2015 will also feature nine of the hottest bands from all over the Bay Area with Beta State, Family Crest, Picture Atlantic, Panic is Perfect and many more.

iHeartMedia's San Antonio Headquarters Sold To Developer

THE MOUTH, MARCH 6TH, 2015 –– iHeartMedia has sold its San Antonio headquarters on E. Basse to real estate firm Casey Development reports bizjournal.com. Casey will now become iHeartMedia's landlord. Casey purchased the 53,789-square-foot building and will now be leasing a portion of the space back to iHeartMedia. The iHeartMedia property was put on the market last summer as part of a sale and lease-back deal. Casey said A lot of other people were interested, but we had a little bit more of a creative offer." The deal initially had iHeart leasing back the entire building, but Casey offered them the option of reducing its space and turning the property into a multi-tenant building. Whether this signals the beginning of the end for iHeartMedia's presence in San Antonio remains to be seen.

New York Station Says All-Year Christmas Format Is No Stunt

THE MOUTH, MARCH 6TH, 2015 –– Do you hear what I hear? Hmmmm. You may have heard about the Albany radio station now playing Christmas music all year long as Santa 105.7 and the company said the holiday music is not a stunt. According to syracuse.com, owner Townsquare Media said market research revealed a strong demand for holiday hits all year long. The company said the holiday music is not a stunt and promises "everything from Sting to Bing." Townsquare Media's local market president, Jake Demmin, wrote in a statement. "There's literally a clamoring for Christmas music 24/7/365/52." So have yourself a merry little Christmas. Forever." Not sure if it will make it for all 365 days, but if it can hold out until October, it's got a shot. Stay tuned.

Big Boy Makes His Big Move Beginning Monday

THE MOUTH, MARCH 5TH, 2015 –– No sooner had a judge lifted an injunction blocking longtime KPWR/Power 106 LA's Big Boy from crossing over to iHeartMedia's Real 92.3 came the announcement his first show will air on Monday, March 9th. “You can’t say Hip Hop in Los Angeles and not immediately think of Big Boy,” says Greg Ashlock, President – Southern California, iHeartMedia. “He’s authentic. Passionate about the music with tight artist relationships. And, most importantly, connected with Los Angelenos. This is a major coup for us here at iHeartMedia Los Angeles, and a big win for the LA Hip Hop audience.” “You can’t imagine how psyched and ready I am to show my listeners – my family – what we’ve got planned at Real 92.3,” said Big Boy. “iHeartMedia 100 percent gets what I’ve been doing for over 20 years and together we’re going to take it to the next level. Love and gratitude to my listeners. You all mean everything to me and I’ll see you real soon.” “What else can I say -- this isn’t just huge, this is Big!,” said Doc Wynter, iHeartMedia’s Senior Vice President of Urban Programming and Program Director of Real 92.3. “ Big Boy posted on social media: Yo potnah, Big Boy is now at our new address, Real 92.3 I do wanna thank you guys for supporting me and laughing with me for years. We have more years to come ... The saga continues....."

Radio Stars Among The Honorees At 40th Annual Gracies Awards

THE MOUTH, Over the past 40 years, the Alliance for Women In Media Foundation (AWMF ) has annually honored exemplary women and men in the media and entertainment industry – individuals who are pioneer s in their respective fields and lead by example. This year’s 40th Anniversary Gracies Awards is being held on Tuesday, May 19 at the Beverly Hilton Hotel . The evening will honor such luminaries as Julia Roberts, Maggie Gyllenhaal, Olivia Munn, and Mae Whitman, among many others. Rubbing elbows with some the biggest names in media will also be radio stars such as Loren Raye, Co host of The TJ Show Outstanding Morning/Afternoon Drive Personality CBS Radio - WODS Radio/Boston, MA, Magic 106.7's - NASH Matters with Kelly Ford (shown) - Outstanding Interview Program or Feature NASH - FM 94 -7 - Pat Kiernan & Rita Cosby Outstanding Talk Show - News WABC Radio, Cumulus Network Radio - For updates on the award s ceremony and luncheon, please visit www.thegracies.org. SEE COMPLETE LIST HERE

Tom Joyner Show Now On Play.It Podcast Network

THE MOUTH, MARCH 5TH, 2015 –– Beginning this week, The Tom Joyner Morning Show will be available for on-demand listening on Play.it, CBS' new podcast network that was launched earlier this year. Play.it brings together digital-exclusive programming from major brands and publishers as well as content from CBS RADIO shows on demand. Play.it offers more than 300 premium content podcasts, including programs from well-known CBS personalities like Boomer Esiason & Craig Carton, Carson Daly, and Kevin & Bean, as well as content from leading news, lifestyle, sports and media brands including 48 HOURS, 60 MINUTES, CBS Sports Radio, Foursquare, Deadspin, and Simon & Schuster, among others. The Tom Joyner Morning Show features co-hosts Sybil Wilkes and J. Anthony Brown also features senior news analyst Roland Martin and “Inside Her Story” with Jacque Reid. In addition, CNN Newsroom Anchor Don Lemon contributes commentary, Sherri Shepherd co-hosts every Thursday and comedian Gary Owen contributes weekly. The Tom Joyner Morning Show is distributed by REACH Media Inc, a part of the Radio One family.

EXECUTIVE ACTION: Beasley Names Georgia Beasley To Sales Management Post/Augusta

THE MOUTH, MARCH 5TH, 2015 –– Beasley Media Group announced the appointment of Georgia Beasley as General Sales Manager of New Country Kicks 99 WKXC-FM and 93.9 BOB-FM WDRR-FM and Digital Sales Manager for all of its seven Augusta radio stations. Prior to this appointment, Georgia has held sales management positions in Miami and Wilmington, Delaware. Georgia entered the radio industry upon her graduation from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill in 2006. Georgia Beasley says, “I’m extremely happy to be a member of the Augusta team! Although I thoroughly enjoyed my time in South Florida, and will miss my family, my heart is in the growth, future and evolution of this company and in continuing my grandfather’s legacy. The Augusta cluster presents a unique opportunity as I can continue my growth within our company while at the same time applying my passion for the non-traditional revenue (NTR) and digital space. Georgia Beasley can be congratulated at georgia.beasley@bbgi.com.

Westwood One News Covers Top News From Tehran To Boston

THE MOUTH, MARCH 5TH, 2015 –– Needless to say, it's been a big week for world news. This week, Westwood One News, powered by CNN, was the only radio network with a reporter in Tehran filing reports on reaction to Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu’s speech to Congress and the ongoing talks in Geneva on a possible deal to restrict Iran’s nuclear program. CNN Correspondent Frederik Pleitgen, one of the few Western journalists in Tehran, filed reports directly to Westwood One News and his reports were heard on newscasts and made available to affiliated stations throughout the day. Meanwhile, Westwood One News correspondent Steve Kastenbaum (shown) was reporting from outside the federal courthouse in Boston yesterday for the first day of the Boston Marathon bombing trial. Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, who is on trial, is charged with 30 counts related to the bombings. Look for more updates in the days ahead.

NETWORKS: Premiere Launches 'The Evolution Beatport Show With Pete Tong; Envision's The Chop Shop Brings Guitar Classics To Little Rock

THE MOUTH, MARCH 5TH, 2015 –– Premiere Networks announced it will begin providing international distribution for The Evolution Beatport Show with Pete Tong. Effective immediately, the popular electronic dance music program will be made available to CHR and Rhythmic radio stations worldwide. The Evolution Beatport Show with Pete Tong is a two-hour, weekly program featuring iconic radio DJ Pete Tong as he showcases the best music from the biggest and most influential DJs, artists and dance music producers in the world. Launched in May 2013, The Evolution Beatport Show with Pete Tong is available for air Tuesday through Sunday, and currently broadcasts weekly on more than 80 stations in the U.S., including Z100 in New York, 102.7 KIIS-FM in Los Angeles and 103.5 KISS-FM in Chicago. Tong continues to host BBC Radio 1’s renowned Pete Tong Show and the Essential Mix radio show, as well as All Gone Pete Tong, which can be heard daily on Evolution 93.5 in Miami, as well as iHeartRadio’s Evolution channel. For more information, please visit http://www.petetong.com/.

Envision Networks® is proud to welcome WRD Entertainment, Inc.’s KZLE-FM/Little Rock, AR as the latest affiliate of The Chop Shop. With 93 KZLE playing “The Absolute Best Mix of Rock” and broadcasting The Chop Shop Classic every Sunday morning at 10 a.m., it joins over 350 affiliates on the Envision Rock Network. The Chop Shop and The Chop Shop Classic feature weekly updates on bands and tours, web exclusive content, and special guests all while playing 10 songs an hour. Both versions are two hours in length and feature weekly interviews as well as the exclusive Chop Shop Hall of Fame feature, where such guests as Ted Nugent, Brian May, Leslie West, and hundreds of others pay tribute to guitar legends Eddie Van Halen, Jimi Hendrix, Angus Young, Slash and more. Interested stations should contact Valerie Brooks at valerieb@envisionradio.com or 216-831-3761 for broadcast details.

[WATCH] 'It's Not Cool For Critics To Like Nickleback, Right?' 'The Haters Are Gonna Hate,' Says Frontman Chad Kroeger

THE MOUTH, MARCH 5TH, 2015 –– As you'll see, there is a lot that goes on behind the scenes at a concert before you ever take your seat. Especially, when the venue is a hockey rink. In addition to an in-depth interview with Nickleback frontman, Chad Kroeger, Quad Cities/97X beloved Dwyer and Michaels added a time-lapse video of the bands conversion of this rink before their recent performance at the iWireless Center in Moline, Ill. Chad Kroeger then sat down for an extended chat with the morning duo covering everything from the band’s love of the hit Canadian show The Trailer Park Boys. Kroeger also discussed being one of the most polarizing acts in rock and dealing with critical backlash. The vocalist explained, “Critics, it’s not cool to like Nickelback, right? A critic would be ostracized from the critic club if they wrote anything nice about us. We’ve made eight albums, been a band for 19 years, still touring, still making records, still having a blast doing it, so it really doesn’t matter what they say. The haters are gonna hate. But if you’re gonna make fun of the band, do a good job.” He went on to add that he’s aware of the haters and the band themselves actually enjoy some of the more humorous comments. “We are the most self-deprecating band out there. We rip on ourselves, but at least when we do it, it’s clever.' Check out the full interview and watch the amazing stage transformation HERE

TOP NEWS FROM AROUND THE WORLD

Another Major Radio Star To Leave BBC's Radio 1

By Graham Mack

THE MOUTH, MARCH 5TH, 2015 –– BBC Radio 1 mid-morning presenter Fearne Cotton is leaving the station after confirming she is pregnant with her second child. She’s been at the station for a decade and has been presenting the morning show since 2009, taking over from Jo Whiley. Fearne thanked Radio 1 and her listeners today, but says it’s time for a new chapter. Official Chart Show presenter Clara Amfo will take over the weekday 10am – 1pm show from from Monday 25 May including the Live Lounge. Clara joined the station from KISS FM UK via 1 Xtra where she will step down from hosting the Weekend Breakfast Show (6-10am) on Sunday 17 May.

Rick Houghton Joins Signal 1 For Drivetime - Rick Houghton has joined Signal 1 in Stoke-on-Trent in England to host the Afternoon Drive Time show. Rick has worked in radio since leaving school at 16, working on numerous stations in the North of England. He also spent five years on breakfast at Channel 4 in Dubai. He takes over from Martin Lowes who has moved to Capital North East to present afternoon drive.

Need an international broadcaster to talk on your show about what’s happening in the UK? – Please call me on +44 7752 416905. Twitter: @GrahamMack Web: www.mackmedia.co.uk Email: graham@mackmedia.co.uk
